intro: Exacum pallescens, commonly known as the pale-flowered geranium, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, showy flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of pale pink to white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in a fine layer of silky hairs. Exacum pallescens is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental value and ability to thrive in various garden conditions.
